item.title: Pothole & building material, 30th September
item.description:
This pothole has been here for almost a year. There is no sign of resolution and it's affecting access to the property, there's a massive sign blocking the pavement & a hole which is a risk for people. Furthermore, the concrete and soil that came out of the hole have been left there for the same duration.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Milton Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barrier no longer prevents access to park from main road, 30th September
item.description:
The road barrier does not extend enough to prevent vehicles from gaining unauthorised access to the park from the main road. The state of the dirt indicates this path sees regular use. Delivery bikes and mopeds are often seen driving through the local park and endangering pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There was a car crash on my property, 30th September
item.description:
A car crashed on my property, can someone please remove it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnt Ash Lane, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tables and chairs on pavement, 30th September
item.description:
I previously reported this problem in August. The restaurant has seating on the pavement also they rope off a large section of the pavement which is very narrow anyway making it difficult for pedestrians, mobility scooters, and prams. I have contacted the licensing officer and the premises do not have a license for the seating. Please take the appropriate action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Hill Alley, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human excrement on pavement, 30th September
item.description:
The usual culprit has used the pavement in our street as their personal latrine once more. You guys at HC need a category for "Human waste", because this happens regularly in our street, and we can't be the only ones who suffer. ðŸ¤®

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gould Terrace, Hackney, London

item.title: Our street is drowning in a sea of recycling bags!!!, 30th September
item.description:
No collection made last week Friday and now the street is a sea of green bags... which is attracting all the neighbourhood lowlife to treat our street as the flytipping rubbish ground. PLEASE collect it now - & don't just wait until the next collection

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gould Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
